title: Particle motion from dx/dt and dy/dt part - c

content.description: For t ≥ 0, a particle is moving along a curve so that its position at time t is (x(t), y(t)). At time t = 2, the particle is at position (1, 5). It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mi>t</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamiEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9maalaaabaWaaOaa aeaacaWG0bGaey4kaSIaaGOmaaWcbeaaaOqaaiaadwgadaahaaWcbe qaaiaadshaaaaaaaaa@3FAC@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGKbGaamyEaaqaaiaadsgacaWG0baaaiabg2da9iGacohacaGGPbGa aiOBamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiaadshaaaa@3F95@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Find the speed of the particle at time t = 4. Find the acceleration vector of the particle at time t = 4.

frqParts.text: Find the speed of the particle at time t = 4. Find the acceleration vector of the particle at time t = 4.
